(Amendment of Rule 3B)
2. DPAR 7 SCR 2014, Dated : 15.12.2015
(Amendment of Rule 3)
3. DPAR 204 SCR 2018, Dated: 26.09.2019
(Amendment of Rule 3 and Substitution of Rule 3F)
4. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated: 24.03.2021
(Substitution of the expression Typists, Amendment of Rule 2,
Substitution of Rule 3, Amendment of Rule 3B, 3C, Substitution
of the words “Physically handicapped and Insertion of Annexures)
GOVERNMENT OF KARNATAKA
KARNATAKA CIVIL SERVICES (Recruitment to the Posts of
Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants) Rules, 1983.
Notification No. DPAR 27 SCR 83 Bangalore, dated 10th May 1983.
(Amended as on 31st May 2021)
In exercise of the powers conferred by the proviso to article 309 of the
Constitution of India, the Governor of Karnataka hereby makes the following rules,
namely:-
1.Title Commencement and application:-
(1) These rules may be called the Karnataka Civil Services(Recruitment to
the posts of Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants) Rules, 1983.
(2) They shall come into force on the date of their publication in the official
Gazette.
(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in the rules of recruitment specially
made in respect of any service or category of posts, the provisions of these rules
shall apply to recruitment to the cadres of Stenographers and Data Entry
Assistants in the Karnataka State Civil Services, 1[except these in the Directorate
of NCC, the Karnataka Administrative Tribunal, the Office of the Advocate
General,] 2[the subordinate courts, the Department of Prosecutions and
Governments Litigations,]
3[on the staff of the Lokayukta and Upalokayukta,] 4[on the staff of the
Karnataka State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission] 5[ and in the Office of
the Resident Commissioner, Karnataka Bhavan, New Delhi.
1. Inserted vide Notification No. DPAR 34 SCR 85, dated 21.02.1986
2. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 57 SCR 86, dated 09.09.1986
3. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 79 SCR 87, dated 28.12.1987
4. Inserted vide Notification No. DPAR 29 SCR 2003, dated 21.06.2004
5. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 37 SCR 92, dated 02.06.1995
2. 1[Method of direct recruitment : -
“(1) Direct Recruitment to the post of Stenographers and Data Entry
Assistants under these rules shall be as follows:-
(a) Every person who is not disqualified under the Karnataka
State Civil Services (General Recruitment) Rules, 1977 shall be
eligible to apply for direct recruitment to the cadre of Stenographers
and Data Entry Assistants, if he has passed the qualifying
examinations specified in rule 3. These qualifying examinations
shall only be a eligibility criteria and the marks in the qualifying
examinations is not considered in the selection process.
(b) The Selecting Authority shall conduct a competitive
examination to these candidates as specified in Annexure-I of these
rules as per the syllabus specified in Annexure-II and prepare a
merit list in the ratio of 1:5 and the candidates selected in the merit
list shall be eligible for the Skill Test.
(c) The Selecting Authority shall conduct a Skill Test to the
candidates as specified in Annexure-III in respect to the post of
Stenographers and Annexure-IV in respect to the post of Data Entry
Assistants as per the merit list prepared as specified in (b) above.
The candidates who secures fifty percent and above in the Skill Test
shall be eligible for further consideration in the selection list. The
selection list shall be prepared in the order of merit determined on
the basis of total marks secured by the candidates in the skill test.
(d) Th e selection of candidates shall be made taking into consideration the orders
in force relating to reservation of appointments and posts for the persons belonging to the
Scheduled Castes, the Scheduled Tribes, other Backward Classes and others as per orders
or rules governing reservations. If two or more candidates have secured equal marks in
the Competitive Examination or Skill Test, the order of merit among such candidates
shall be fixed on the basis of their age, the person older in the age being placed higher in
the order of merit.
(2) The selection of candidates shall be made by an officer, (hereinafter
referred to as the “selecting authority”) appointed for the purpose by the
Government of Karnataka.]
1. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87(II), dated : 06.04.1987
2. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 07 SCR 2014 , dated 15.12.2015
3. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, dated: 24.03.2021.
3. Academic qualification of candidates:- The qualification prescribed to the
post of Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants are as under:-
(1) In respect of Stenographers:-He must have passed,-
(a) PUC or possess an equivalent qualification; and
(b) Senior Typewriting and Senior Shorthand Examination in Kannada
conducted by the Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board
or possess an equivalent qualification; or
(c) Diploma in Commercial Practice with Kannada Typewriting and
Kannada Shorthand or possess an equivalent qualification.
(2) In respect of Data Entry Assistants:- He must have passed,-
(a) PUC or possess an equivalent qualification; and
(b) Senior Typewriting Examination in Kannada conducted by the
Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board or possess an
equivalent qualification; or
(c) Diploma in Commercial Practice with Kannada Typewriting or possess
an equivalent qualification.
Note:- The above qualifications prescribed as only minimum qualifications
for eligibility to apply for the above posts.
4[3A. Intimation of vacancies to the selecting authority :-
The appointing authorities in each department shall communicate the
selecting authority. The number of direct recruitment vacancies in the cadres of
Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants relating to their department duly
classifying such vacancies in accordance with the orders in force relating to
reservation of appointments and posts of Scheduled Castes Scheduled Tribes,
Other Backward Classes, Ex-Servicemen and Persons with benchmark disability.]
1. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 84 SCR 84, dated: 12.02.1988
2. Omitted vide Notification No. DPAR 86 SCR 83, dated: 07.07.1984
3. Inserted vide Notification No. DPAR 16 2000, dated : 18.05.2002
4. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87 (II), dated : 06.04.1987
5. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 7 SCR 2014, dated: 15.12.2015
6. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, dated 24.03.2021
1[3B. Inviting applications:-
(1) The selecting Authority shall advertise the vacancies in the Official
Gazette specifying the conditions of eligibility, the nature of selection, the number
of vacancies to be filled, the number required to be filled by persons belonging to
the Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Other Backward classes and by Ex-
service men and Persons with benchmark disability and invite applications from
intending candidates. Abstract of such advertisements shall be published in
newspapers.
(2) Application shall be made in the form specified by the selecting
authority.
"(3) Every applicant shall remit along with his application a fee as specified by the
Selecting Authority:
Provided that, no fee shall be payable by a candidate belonging to the
Scheduled Castes, the Scheduled Tribes and Category-I of other Backward Classes.”
(4) The applicant who applies for the post of Stenographer or Data Entry
Assistants for which he wishes to be considered for appointment in the order of
preference. If the candidate does not prefer any service or post he may be considered
for remaining unpreferred vacant posts or service.
1[3C. List of selected candidates:
(1) The selecting authority shall on the basis of total marks secured by the
candidates in the skill test and after taking into account the orders in force relating
to reservation of appointments and posts for Scheduled Castes, Schedules Tribes,
Other Backward Classes, Ex-servicemen and Persons with benchmark disability,
prepare a list in the order of merit of candidates eligible for appointment in respect
of each cadre or post. The number of candidates to be included in such list shall be
equal to the total number of vacancies intimated under rule 3A till the date of
advertisement under rule 3B or such other later date as may be decided by the
selecting authority.
1.
Submitted vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87, Dated 06.04.1987
2. Inserted vide Notification No. DPAR 58 SCR 2012, Dated 05.09.2015
3. Submitted Vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated 24.03.2021
(2) The selecting authority after taking into consideration the orders relating
to reservation of appointments and posts for Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes
and Other Backward classes and having regard to the order of merit and the
preference indicated by the candidates shall assign the selected candidates under
intimation to them to the different appointing authorities.
(3) (a) The Commission shall, prepare a single additional list of candidates in
the manner the select list is prepared under sub-rule (1), excluding those in the
list prepared under sub-rule (1). The total number of candidates to be included in
the additional list shall not exceed thirty percent of the total number of the
candidates included in the list prepared under sub-rule (1).
(b) An appointing authority may seek assignment of candidates from the
additional list prepared by the commission under clause (a) appoint candidates in
the additional list to the extent the candidates do not report for duty within the
specified or extended period of joining time, as the case may be. In such a case, a
candidate to be assigned from the additional list shall belong to the same category
of vertical and horizontal reservation to which the candidate who did not report for
duty belonged:
Provided that, no requisition for assignment of candidates included in the
additional list shall be sent by the appointing authority until all the candidates
included in the list prepared under sub-rule (1) and assigned under sub-rule (2) and
found suitable for appointment are issued orders of appointment.
(c) The appointing authority obtaining additional list of candidates for
appointment to the posts of stenographers and Data Entry Assistants from the
Commission under this sub-rule after verifying that the candidates is found
suitable for appointment shall issue orders of appointment to the candidates in the
order in which their names are arranged in the list sent by the Commission to the
extent to the candidates from main select list do not report to duty.
(4) The selecting authority shall publish the lists prepared under sub-rule (1)
and sub-rule (2) in the Karnataka Gazette and its website and such other media of
publicity as it may deem fit. The selecting authority shall send copies of the lists
to the appointing authorities and intimate the fact of selection to the selected
candidates by registered post.
.
1 Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 204 SCR 2018, Dated 26.09.2019
2. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated : 24.03.2021
[3D. Appointment of Candidates :-
(1) Candidates whose names are included in the list prepared by the selecting
authority under sub-rule(2) of rule 3C may be appointed by the appointing
authority, in the order in which the names are found in the list after satisfying itself
after such enquiry as any be considered necessary that each such candidate is
suitable in all respects for appointment to a post in the cadre.
(2) Candidates whose names are included in the list received in sub-rule (3) of
rule 3C may be also appointed by appointing authority in unfilled vacancies or
additional vacancies if any in the manner as specified in sub-rule(1).
[3E. Reassignment of selected candidates :-
Where a candidate selected and assigned to an appointing authority for
appointment to the cadre of Stenographers of Data Entry Assistants is not
appointed for any administrative reasons, the selecting authority shall be informed
by the concerned appointing authority immediately specifying the reason therefore,
and on receipt of such intimation the selecting authority shall reassign the
candidate under intimation to him to any other appointing authority, where
vacancies are available for appointment.
“3F. Period of Operation of the lists and additional list.- A list of
selected candidates prepared under sub-rule (1) of rule 3C and additional list
prepared under sub-rule (3) shall be in force for a period of two years from the date
of its publication or the date of publication of a list prepared on the basis of the
next selection, whichever is earlier.
.
1 Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87, Dated 06.04.1987
.
2 Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 204 SCR 2018, Dated 26.09.2019
3. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated : 24.03.2021
1[3G. Special provision regarding first appointment under these rules:-
Notwithstanding anything contained in these rules, the applications received
in response to the Notifications under SLR 13 STR 85, dated 25th May, 1985, SLR
17 STR 85, dated 25th June, 1985 and SLR 13 STR 85, dated 11th July 1985
notified by the Recruitment Committee constituted under rule 3 of the Karnataka
State Civil Services(Recruitment Committees) Rules, 1982 for direct recruitment
to the posts of Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants, shall be finalized by the
Selecting Authority in accordance with these rules as amended by the Karnataka
Civil Services (Recruitment to the Posts of Stenographers and Typists)
(Amendment) Rules, 1987 after obtaining fresh declaration if not already obtained
earlier in accordance with the Government order NO. DPAR 28 SBC 86, dated the
12th day of December, 1986, from the applicants who are eligible as on the last date
fixed for receipt of the said applications, and the selecting authority shall assign or
reassign the selected candidates to the different appointing authorities under rule
3C or 3E as the case may be.]
4. Minimum qualification for recruitment by promotion ;
No 1[person] shall be eligible for promotion to the posts of stenographers in
any State Civil Services unless he possesses-
(a) 2[Senior Typewriting and Senior Shorthand examination in
Kannada conducted by the Karnataka Secondary Education
Examination Board or possesses an equivalent
qualification.]
(b) 3[xxxxxx] Omitted.
(c) 3[Note] Omitted.
.
1 Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87, Dated 6.04.1987
2. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 39 SCR 85, Dated 25.07.1985
3. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 84 SCR 84, Dated 12.02.1988
4. Omitted Vide Notification No. DPAR 86 SCR 83, dated: 07.07.1984
5. Substituted vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated 24.03.2021
Provided that these rules shall not be applicable to 1[persons] already in
service on the date of commencement of these rules, for a period of three years
from the date of such commencement and during the said period of three years
they shall be eligible for promotion to the posts of stenographers if they-
(a) have passed the Senior Shorthand Examination in
English or Kannada conducted by the Department of
Public Instruction ; or
(b) are holders of a Diploma in Secretarial Practice with
English or Kannada as optional (elective) subject granted
by the Board of Technical Education in Karnataka, or
(c) possess an equivalent qualification.
1[4A. Application of other rules:-
The Karnataka Civil Services (General Recruitment) Rules, 1977, and the
Karnataka Civil Services (Special) Rules, 1982 and other rules of recruitment
specially made in respect of Stenographers and Data Entry Assistants shall apply in
respect of matters for which no provision is made in these rules.]
5. Repeal and savings :- (1) The Karnataka Civil Services (Recruitment to the
posts of Stenographers, Junior Stenographers and Typists) Rules, 1977, are hereby
repealed.
Provided that the said repeal shall not affect the previous operations of the said
rules of anything duly done or suffered there under or affect any right, liability or
obligation acquired or incurred under the said rules.
(2) Any reference in any rules of recruitment specially made and applicable to
any service or category or posts relating to recruitment to the cadre of Data Entry
Assistants and Stenographers to the rules repealed by sub-rule (1) shall be
construed as a reference to these rules.
1.
Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 25 SCR 87, Dated 06.04.1987
2. Substituted Vide Notification No. DPAR 105 SCR 2017, Dated 24.03.2021
Annexure-I
(see rule-2)
Model for Competitive Examination
(a) The Competitive examination shall consist of the following subjects to
the post of Stenographer and Data Entry Assistant:-
Scheme of Exam:
Sl. Subject No. of Maximum Exam
No. Questions Marks Duration
1. General Knowledge 25 25
2. General Kannada 25 25
3. General English 25 25 90 Minutes
4. Computer Knowledge 25 25
Total 100 100
(b) Question paper shall be of objective type Multiple Choice only.
(c) There shall be negative marking of 0.25 marks for each wrong answer.
Annexure-II
(see rule-2)
Competitive Examination Syllabus for Direct Recruitment to the posts of
Stenographer and Data Entry Assistant
(1) General Knowledge: (Maximum Marks-25)
(a) General Intelligence:-
Analogies, Similarities and differences, Space Visualization, Problem
Solving, Analysis, Judgment, Decision making Visual memory,
Discriminating observation, Relationship concepts, Arithmetic reasoning,
Verbal and Figure Classification, Arithmetical number series, Non-verbal
series etc, Abstract ideas and symbols, Relationship, arithmetic
computation, analytical functions of abstract ideas and symbols.
(b) General Awareness:-
Matters of Every Day Observation, Indian History with special reference to
Karnataka, Indian Geography with special reference to Karnataka,
Indian Constitution, State and Regional Administration, Awards and
Honors, Economic development in Karnataka, Days and Events, Books and
Authors, Environmental problems and the development issues of Karnataka,
Science and Technology.
(2) General Kannada: (Maximum Marks-25)
The paper on General Kannada shall normally confirm to the minimum standard
expected of a student who has passed the PUC Examination. It is extended to
test candidate’s knowledge of Kannada grammar, vocabulary, spelling,
synonyms, antonyms his power to understand and comprehend Kannada
language and his ability to discriminate between correct and incorrect usage,
etc.
(3) General English: (Maximum Marks-25)
Basic English Grammar and sentence structure Parts of Speech-Noun, Pronoun,
Verb, Preposition, Conjunction, etc., Articles, Active and Passive Voice, Direct
and Indirect Speech, Fill in the Blanks, Sentence Correction, Spellings, Phrases
and Idioms, Antonyms and Synonyms, Spotting errors, Para jumbles, Phrase
replacement.
(4) Computer Knowledge: (Maximum Marks-25)
Computer Fundamentals and Windows-Word Processing MS-Word, Spread
sheet and MS-Excel, Computer communication, Internet, E-mail, Nudi Kannada
software knowledge in word processing, Power Point.
Annexure –III
(see rule-2)

Speed (34 WPM).

THE KARNATAKA CIVIL SERVICES (TYPISTS AND JUNIOR
ASSISTANTS / SECOND DIVISION ASSISTANTS (CHANGE OF CADRE)
RULES, 1964.
(As amended upto 31st December 1988)
GENERAL ADMINISTRATION DEPARTMENT
NOTIFICATION
Bangalore, dated 26th September 1964.
In exercise of the powers conferred by the proviso to Article 309 of the
Constitution and with the previous approval of the Government of India as
required by the proviso to sub-section (7) of Section 115 of the State Re-
organisation Act, 1956 (Central Act 37 of 1956), the Governor of Karnataka
hereby makes the following Rules, namely:-
1. Title.- These rules may be called the Karnataka Civil Services
(Typists and Junior Assistants / Second Division Assistants) (Change of Cadre)
Rules, 1964.
2. Change of Cadre.- Notwithstanding anything in the rules of
recruitment specially made in respect of any service.
(i) a Typists possessing the qualifications prescribed for the post of Junior
Assistants / Second Division Assistants may change his cadre to that of a Junior
Assistant / Second Division Assistant, as the case may be, and
(ii) a Junior Assistant / Second Division Assistant possessing the
qualifications prescribed for the post of Typist may change his cadre to that of
Typist, provided that no person shall be eligible to change his cadre unless he has
put in not less than five years of service excluding the period of probation* or
officiation and the period of service if any, rendered by him as a local candidate in
the cadre of Typists or as the case may be Junior Assistant / Second Division
Assistant.
3. Procedure.- (1) Persons desiring to change their cadre under rule 2
shall make an application to the authority who appointed them requesting for the
change of cadre.
(2) On receipt of the application under sub-rule (1), the appointing authority
may if satisfied that the applicant is entitled to change the cadre pass orders
granting the request.
4. Permission to be granted only once.- No Government servant shall
be permitted to change his cadre under rule 2 more than once.
**“5. Effect of change of cadre.- (1) Notwithstanding anything contained
in the Karnataka Government Servant’s (Seniority) Rules, 1957 or any other rules
and except as provided in sub-rule (2), a person who has been permitted to change
his cadre under rule 2 shall be entitled to count his previous service for purposes of
leave, pension and seniority.
Provided that,-
(a) he shall not be entitled to count for seniority his previous service
rendered as a local candidate; and
(b) in the case of a Typist (other than an allottee under the States’
Reorganisation Act, 1956) who has changed his cadre to that of Junior
Assistant or Second Division Assistant a further period of two years shall
be excluded from the previous service for the purpose of seniority in the
changed cadre.
(2) A person who has been permitted to change his cadre under rule 2 shall
not be considered for promotion unless he has put in service of at least one year in
the changed cadre and such person shall not have any claim for seniority or for
promotion to the next higher cadre over persons who are promoted before he
becomes eligible for promotion”.
By order and in the name of the Government of
Karnataka,
(SYED ZAHEERUDDIN HASSAN)
Under Secretary to Government,
General Administration Department(O and M)
(*) (Inserted Vide Notification No. DPAR 65 SCR 81, dated 12th
October, 1982).
(**) Inserted Vide Notification No. DPAR 42 SCR 85, dated 12th August
1986.
ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ಸಿವಿಲ್ ಸೇವಾ (ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರರು ಮತ್ತು ಕಿರಿಯ ಸಹಾಯಕರುಗಳು, ದ್ವಿ ತೀಯ
ದರ್ಜಾ ಸಹಾಯಕರುಗಳ ) (ಉದ್ಯ ೀಗಿವೃಂದದ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ) ನಿಯಮಗಳು, 1964.
(1988 ರ ಡಿಸೃಂಬರ್ 31 ರವರೆಗೆ ತದ್ದು ಪಡಿಯಾದಂತೆ)
ಸಾಮಾರ್ನಯ ಡಳಿತ ಇಲಾಖೆ
ಅಧಿಸೂಚನೆ
ಬೆೃಂಗಳೂರು, ದ್ವರ್ನೃಂಕ 26ನೇ ಸಪ್ಟ ೃಂಬರ್ 1964
ಸಂವಿಧಾನದ 309ನೇ ಪರಂತುಕದಿಂದ ಪರ ದತ್ತ ವಾದ ಅಧಿಕಾರಗಳನ್ನು ಚಲಾಯಿಸಿ ಮತುತ
1956ರ ರಾಜ್ಯ ಪುನಸ್ಸ ಿಂಘಟನಾ ಅಧಿನಿಯಮ (1956ರ ಕಿಂದರ ಅಧಿನಿಯಮ 37)ದ 115ನೇ ಪರ ಕರಣದ
(7)ನೇ ಉಪ ಪರ ಕರಣದ ಪರಂತುಕದಿಂದ ಅಗತ್ಯ ಪಡಿಸಿದಂತೆ ಭಾರತ್ ಸ್ಕಾಾರದ
ಪೂವಾಾನ್ನಮೋದನೆಯಿಂದಗೆ ಕನಾಾಟಕದ ರಾಜ್ಯ ಪಾಲರು ಈ ಮಿಂದನ ನಿಯಮಗಳನ್ನು ಈ
ಮೂಲಕ ರಚಿಸುತ್ತತ ರೆ ಎಿಂದರೆ:-
1. ಹೆಸರು.- ಈ ನಿಯಮಗಳನ್ನು ಕನಾಾಟಕ ಸಿವಿಲ್ ಸೇವಾ (ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರರು ಮತುತ
ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕರುಗಳು ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕರುಗಳ) (ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದದ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ)
ನಿಯಮಗಳು, 1964 ಎಿಂದು ಕರೆಯತ್ಕಕ ದುು .
2. ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದದ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ:- ಯಾವುದೇ ಸೇವೆಗೆ ಸಂಬಂಧಿಸಿದಂತೆ ವಿಶೇಷವಾಗಿ
ರಚಿಸ್ಲಾದ ನೇಮಕಾತ ನಿಯಮಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಏನೇ ಇದು ರೂ
(i) ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕರುಗಳ / ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ /ಸ್ಹಾಯಕರುಗಳ ಹುದ್ದು ಗಾಗಿ
ಗೊತುತ ಪಡಿಸಿರುವ ವಿದ್ಯಯ ರ್ಾತೆಗಳನ್ನು ಹಿಂದರುವ ಒಬಬ ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರನ್ನ ತ್ನು
ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಸಂದಭಾಾನ್ನಸಾರವಾಗಿ ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕ / ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ
ಸ್ಹಾಯಕನಾಗಿ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಿಕೊಳಳ ಬಹುದು.
(ii) ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರರ ಹುದ್ದು ಗಾಗಿ ಗೊತುತ ಪಡಿಸಿರುವ ವಿದ್ಯಯ ರ್ಾತೆಗಳನ್ನು ಹಿಂದರುವ ಒಬಬ
ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕ / ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ /ಸ್ಹಾಯಕನ್ನ ತ್ನು ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು
ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರನಾಗಿ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಿಕೊಳಳ ಬಹುದು. ಆದರೆ, ಅವನ್ನ ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರ
ಅಥವಾ ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕ / ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕ * ಮತುತ ಸ್ಥ ಳೋಯ
ಅಭ್ಯ ರ್ಥಾಯಾಗಿ ತ್ತನ್ನ ಸ್ಲ್ಲಿ ಸಿದ ಸೇವೆ ಯಾವುದ್ಯದರೂ ಇದು ರೂ ಆ ಸೇವಾ ಅವಧಿಯನ್ನು
ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದದಲ್ಲಿ ಅರ್ಾತ್ತ ಪರಿೋಕಾಾ ವಧಿ ಅಥವಾ ಸಾಥ ನಾಪನು ಅವಧಿಯನ್ನು
ಹರತುಪಡಿಸಿ, ಐದು ವಷಾಗಳಗೆ ಕಡಿಮೆಯಿಲಿ ದಂತೆ ಸೇವೆ ಸ್ಲ್ಲಿ ಸಿದು ಹರತು, ಅವನ
ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲು ಅರ್ಾನಾಗಿರತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದಲಿ .
3. ಕಾಯಾವಿಧಾನ.- (1) 2ನೇ ನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ತ್ಮಮ ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು
ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲು ಇಚಿು ಸುವ ವಯ ಕಿತ ಗಳು, ತ್ಮಮ ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ
ಮಾಡುವಂತೆ ಕೊೋರಿ ತ್ಮಮ ನ್ನು ನೇಮಕ ಮಾಡಿದ ಪಾರ ಧಿಕಾರಿಗೆ ಅರ್ಜಾಯನ್ನು ಸ್ಲ್ಲಿ ಸ್ತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದು.
(2) (1)ನೇ ಉಪನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ಅರ್ಜಾಯನ್ನು ಸಿಿ ೋಕರಿಸಿದ ತ್ರುವಾಯ ನೇಮಕ
ಪಾರ ಧಿಕಾರಿಯು, ಅರ್ಜಾದ್ಯರನ್ನ ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲು ರ್ಕಕ ನ್ನು
ಹಿಂದದ್ಯು ನೆಿಂದು ಮನವಿರಿಕೆಯಾದರೆ, ಕೊೋರಿಕೆಯನ್ನು ಮಂಜೂರು ಮಾಡುವ
ಆದೇಶಗಳನ್ನು ಹರಡಿಸ್ಬಹುದು.
4. ಅನುಮತಯನುು ಒೃಂದೇ ಒೃಂದ್ದ ಬಾರಿ ನಿೀಡಲಾಗುವುದ್ದ.- ಯಾವನೇ ಸ್ಕಾಾರಿ
ನೌಕರನಿಗೆ 2ನೇ ನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ತ್ನು ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲು ಒಿಂದಕಿಕ ಿಂತ್
ಹೆಚ್ಚು ಬಾರಿ ಅನ್ನಮತ ನಿೋಡತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದಲಿ .
** ಉದ್ಯ ೀಗಿ ವೃಂದ ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಪರಿಣಾಮ:-5. (1) 1957ರ ಕನಾಾಟಕ ಸ್ಕಾಾರಿ ನೌಕರರ
(ಜೇಷಠ ತೆ) ನಿಯಮಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಅಥವಾ ಇತ್ರ ಯಾವುದೇ ನಿಯಮಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಏನೇ ಇದು ರೂ ಮತುತ (2)ನೇ
ಉಪನಿಯಮದಲ್ಲಿ ಉಪಬಂಧಿಸಿರುವಂತೆ ಹರತು, 2ನೇ ನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ತ್ನು ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ
ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲು ಅನ್ನಮತ ಪಡೆದರುವ ವಯ ಕಿತ ಯು ರರ್ಜ, ನಿವತತ ವೇತ್ನ ಮತುತ
ಜೇಷಠ ತೆಯ ಉದ್ದಧ ೋಶಗಳಗಾಗಿ ತ್ನು ಹಿಂದನ ಸೇವಾವಧಿಯನ್ನು ಲೆಕಕ ಕೆಕ ತೆಗೆದುಕೊಳಳ ಲು ರ್ಕಕ ನ್ನು
ಹಿಂದರತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದು.
ಪರಂತು,
(ಎ) ಅವನ್ನ ಸ್ಥ ಳೋಯ ಅಭ್ಯ ರ್ಥಾಯಾಗಿ ಸ್ಲ್ಲಿ ಸಿದ ತ್ನು ಹಿಂದನ ಸೇವೆಯನ್ನು ಜೇಷಠ ತೆಗೆ ಲೆಕಕ ಕೆಕ
ತೆಗೆದುಕೊಳಳ ಲು ರ್ಕಕ ನ್ನು ಹಿಂದರತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದಲಿ ಮತುತ
(ಬಿ) (1956)ರ ರಾಜ್ಯ ಗಳ ಪುನಸ್ಸ ಿಂಘಟನಾ ಅಧಿನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ಹಂಚಿಕೆ ದ್ಯರನಲಿ ದ)
ಕಿರಿಯ ಸ್ಹಾಯಕ ಅಥವಾ ದಿ ತೋಯ ದರ್ಜಾ ಗುಮಾಸ್ತ ನಾಗಿ ತ್ನು ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ
ಮಾಡಿಕೊಿಂಡಿರುವ ಬೆರಳಚ್ಚು ಗಾರನ ಸಂದಭ್ಾದಲ್ಲಿ ಹೆಚಿು ನ ಎರಡು ವಷಾಗಳ ಅವಧಿಯನ್ನು
ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಹಿಂದದ ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದದಲ್ಲಿ ಜೇಷಠ ತೆಯ ಉದ್ದು ೋಶಕಾಕ ಗಿ ಹಿಂದನ ಸೇವೆಯಿಿಂದ
ಹರತುಪಡಿಸ್ತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದು.
(2) 2ನೇ ನಿಯಮದ ಮೇರೆಗೆ ತ್ನು ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದವನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಿಕೊಳಳ ಲು
ಅನ್ನಮತ ಹಿಂದದ ಒಬಬ ವಯ ಕಿತ ಯನ್ನು ಬದಲಾವಣೆ ಹಿಂದದ ಉದ್ಯ ೋಗಿ ವಿಂದದಲ್ಲಿ ಕಡೇ ಪಕ್ಷ
ಒಿಂದು ವಷಾ ಸೇವೆ ಸ್ಲ್ಲಿ ಸಿದು ಹರತು ಬಡಿತ ಗೆ ಪರಿಗಣಿಸ್ತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದಲಿ ಮತುತ ಅವನ್ನ ಬಡಿತ ಗೆ
ಅರ್ಾನಾಗುವುದಕೆಕ ಮಿಂಚೆ ಬಡಿತ ಹಿಂದದ ವಯ ಕಿತ ಗಳ ಮೇಲೆ ಜೇಷಠ ತೆಯನ್ನು ಕೆಿ ೋಮ ಮಾಡಲು
ಅಥವಾ ಮಿಂದನ ಉನು ತ್ ಹುದ್ದು ಗೆ ಬಡಿತ ಹಿಂದಲು ಯಾವುದೇ ಕೆಿ ೋಮನ್ನು ಹಿಂದರತ್ಕ್ಕಕ ದಲಿ .
ಕನಾಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯ ಪಾಲರ ಆದೇಶಾನ್ನಸಾರ ಮತುತ ಅವರ
ಹೆಸ್ರಿನಲ್ಲಿ ,
(ಸೈಯದ್ ಜ್ಹಾರುದು ೋನ್ ರ್ಸಾಸ ನ್)
ಸ್ಕಾಾರದ ಅಧಿೋನ ಕಾಯಾದರ್ಶಾ,
ಸಾಮಾನಾಯ ಡಳತ್ ಇಲಾಖೆ(ಒ ಮತುತ ಎಿಂ)
* ಅಧಿಸೂಚನೆ ಸಂಖೆಯ ಡಿಪಿಎಆರ್ 65 ಎಸ್.ಸಿ.ಆರ್ 81, ದ:01.10.1982
** ಅಧಿಸೂಚನೆ ಸಂಖೆಯ ಡಿಪಿಎಆರ್ 42 ಎಸ್.ಸಿ.ಆರ್ 85, ದನಾಿಂಕ 12.09.86
